fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-4183].
  {panel}

You might want a "themed" layout/decoration, but have each space be able to choose their own colours.
Alternatively, you might want a corporate colour scheme, but want each space to be able to customise their own layouts.

Basically, you want to be able to customise the theme.....
Easiest way is probably to make the theme change the defaults for a space.... (same way the global does...)
fields.summary: Theme aspects should change the defaults for  Space layout/colour - ie the theme aspects should be over-rideable

fields.description:
If you have a url for Space admin :

http://server.name.com/spaces/listdecorators.action?key=BP2I

And you get the space key wrong, then rather than failing gracefully, you end up with an sitemesh decoration of an empty page....

Looking at the code, you can see why:
    public String getSpaceName()
    {
        return action.getSpace().getName();
    }

You should do a null check there....

However, thats addressing the symptom more than the cause - the action should show some kind of friendly error page rather than try and render.

fields.description:
We have a few issues with this re-indexing ... 
CONF-3977 (http://support.atlassian.com/browse/CSP-1450)
and now this.

Basically, when we re-index, we end up running out of cursors - get loads of the errors below:

We had to set the number of open cursors limit (limit per connection) to the rather ridiculous value of 2000 before we could get a successful re-index completion.

And when the re-index was completed, we had 5518 open cursors remaining... which kinda suggests some kind of leakage...

So, I am not sure if the two are related... but I get the feeling they are...

fields.description:
We get the error below.

Probably the reason for this is that http://wiki.london.echonet/ is not available from the server - because it is effecively behind a Network Address Translation layer (our network load balaning switches)

Question is why are we downloading it over http if we can only upload the logo to the server filesystem....

fields.description: I'm trying to get the JIRA NTLM authentication module working with Confluence and seem to be having no luck.  This is a standalone version of Confluence under TomCat, not using JIRA to maintain users.  Screen shot, stack trace, and web.xml are all attached.
fields.summary: NTLM Authentication module for Jira doesn't work with Confluence

fields.description:
I have a page that had an excerpt (see 1-ExcerptFromParentPage.jpg).  When I go to the page, there is no content (see 2-pageItself.jpg).  When I look at history, there is no history (See 3-pageHistory.jpg).  I have also enclosed an old export of this page that was done in HTML.  This page does not have the full text of the excerpt that we see today, but as you can see it is almost there.  Furthermore, this history says that the page was created on May 12th and this HTML says that this page ws last modified on May 12th.  I do not know what that would tell you?  Except that export date on the file system is May 13th.  So this file was intact till at least May 13th.  So where does the history get the date of May 12?  And where does the parent page get the correct excerpt?

Patrick Hill
hillpj__@__wellsfargo.com  (remove the underscores)

Use of Templates in Blog Posts

fields.summary: Recent Changes view ignores page-level permissions for attachments

fields.description:
The export to word link seems to have a bug in the permissioning checks.

For me, it shows up on the TEST space:

http://confluence.atlassian.com/pages/pageinfo.action?pageId=134241

But not on the Confluence space:

http://confluence.atlassian.com/pages/pageinfo.action?pageId=134223
fields.summary: Export to word link not showing for everyone

fields.description:
When watching the DOC space, as a normal user I received creation / update reports (including content and version comments) for the Confluence 1.5-DR2 release notes as I would for any page.

When I went to see the the release notes it told me I was not in the confluence-developers group, so I shouldnt have got the notifications in the first place.

This is the first time I have noticed a security leek regarding to notifications, but there may be others as I havent actively looked for them.
fields.summary: SECURITY BUG - Watching a space / page gives you notification (inc. content) even if you do not have view rights

fields.description:
When I insert an image using the WYSIWYG editor and a remote image (ie "http://confluence.atlassian.com/images/icons/star_grey.gif") I get a broken image displaying.

However when I save the page, it actually writes out the correct link.
fields.summary: Link editor doesn't insert remote links properly

fields.description:
I believe this text won't be interpreted by the round tripping very well:

{info:title=A Tag By Any Other Name}Picking a name for labels wasn't easy. Google's [GMail|http://gmail.google.com] service calls them labels, while other collaborative categorisation systems such as [del.icio.us|http://del.icio.us] and [Flickr|http://www.flickr.com] call them tags. We decided that 'label' was a more natural description. For more information about the philosophy behind labels and tags, check out the [Folksonomy page on Wikipedia|http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Folksonomy]{info}
fields.summary: WYSIWYG editor doesn't find links inside macros

fields.description: Currently the WYSIWYG editor has a popup menu - I think we should remove it, it really adds no value and just takes time to load etc.
fields.summary: Remove the popup menu in WYSIWYG

fields.description:
You can no longer add links to selected text. Selection seems to get lost.

To replicate:
- select a word in the text
- click the link icon
- the selection does not appear as the alias (it should).
fields.summary: Link popup does not take selection into account

fields.description:
* Find a page which you cannot edit / set public labels on.
* Click [edit] to edit the labels
* Enter "these all get rejected except for my:this" and click Add
* Red text appears saying " You are not permitted to add the label 'these' to this page." leaving the input box blank.

The user now has to re-enter and re-try each keyword to see if any others fail. There are 3 things I see needing done:

1. Input box being repopulated with sent data if there is any errors
2. Multiple error checking - dont just stop on the first, error on all the bad keywords
3. More informative errors - like "You are not permitted to add non-personal labels to this page."
fields.summary: Label Usability Improvements

fields.description:
Hi guys, I put this as a feature request, but I hadn't heard back from anyone acknowledging it, so I wondered whether I had  worked the process properly. Here is situation, maybe I'm missing something. New Feature item is here http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONF-4106.

There is no clean way to tell via the remote API whether a particular user is already registered in Confluence. Calling getUser( ) for a user that does not exist throws an exception (rather than politely returning a failure code). Calling addUser( ) for a user that already exists also throws an exception (rather than politely returning a failure code). These exceptions cannot be distinguished from serious exceptions that might somehow occur since they are just HTTP 500 errors with no meaningful description of the cause. The resulting exceptions severly pollute the log since each one throws two separate exceptions to the log for a total of more than 100 lines each. Note that log exceptions may be related to Tomcat only, I vaguely recall it handles error forms a bit differently and maybe doesn't like Confluence custom error pages. 

Use Case Scenario: A new wiki convert/champion has created some spaces and wants their working group (of say, 40 people) to be given access so they can all collaborate using the new spaces. To avoid manually creating users or having users sign up themselves and then have to wait to be given permissions to the space, a bulk user loading mechnism is desired. This allows the announcement and full access for the users to be simultaneous. 

The new champion provides a list of the 40 user ids corresponding to those to be added. The data is loaded by a program that executes an addUser( ) and addUserToGroup( ) call for each listed user. However, some of the 40 people have already gotten access by one means or another. Each time the program attempts to add one of these users, an undistinguished exception is thrown and the program must guess that means they are already registered as a Confluence user. The log fills with meaningless exception trace dumps.
fields.summary: Can't figure out how to detect whether users exists from remote API

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-4153].
  {panel}

It would be nice to have an approval mecanism for certain type of pages. Currently we are importing all our TLD and DD documentation to confluence, but, we do not know if there is a way to implement an approval mechanism so that architects could APPROVE any desing or change request. Although we are either using Jira, and there is the possibility to implement an appoval work flow, it is not preferred because, it will then be unintegrated to confluence pages...
Brief:
* A different space and/or different types of pages/chieldpages where the content is expected to be approved by some authorities... (from different perspective, commented by architects, but somehow differently)

Would be real nice, and facilitate our lifes...

{panel:title=Atlassian Status as of 1st November, 2011|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#3C78B5| titleBGColor=#3C78B5| bgColor=#E7F4FA}
Hi All,

Thank you for your feedback on this issue. On behalf of the Confluence team please accept our apologies for allowing this issue to remain open for some time without any strong direction. Over the last few weeks we've taken a long hard look at this issue and have been considering the strategic nature of this feature request. After much discussion, we wish to inform that we won't be implementing the ability to approve pages and/or spaces.

From speaking to you guys, it is clear everyone has different requirements in terms of the approval process for various content. This naturally opens up the need for the ability for users to create custom approval workflows for pages and/or spaces. With that in mind, there would be a significant amount of product complexity added to implement this. So much so, that we believe this slowly moves away from our initial intentions of making wiki software that is open and collaborative.

However, we do acknowledge that for some of you page approvals is important. With that in mind, we feel this is a perfect opportunity for our ecosystem. There are already some solutions for page workflow approvals available:

* [Ad-Hoc Workflows Plugin from Comala Tech|http://www.adhocworkflows.com/display/WWW/Home]
* [Page Approvals Plugin from Customware|https://plugins.atlassian.com/plugin/details/144]

We also encourage ecosystem developers to consider building a space approval plugin as well.

Cheers,
Sherif Mansour
Confluence Product Manager
sherif at atlassian dot com

{panel}
fields.summary: Space/Page Approval Mechanism

If you currently watch a page you will get an email everytime the page changed.

There is one drawback of this feature: You might be spammed with watch-emails this way. Either because there are many edits or just because you are on holiday and returning you will see a mailbox with hundreds of watch-notifications.

I suggest to have a feature like some forums have: Send the watch-report only once until the user clicks on a "view"-link. Of course this must be emphasized in the email, like:

  You won't receive further notifications of page-updates until you follow the link below: ...

It might be interesting to have this feature configurable in the profile and even a way to reset such blocking, i. e. (in case you moved your mail to trash). You might add such "Clean Auto-Block" to the notifications-panel of the profile-overview.

fields.description:
Because we embed fonts in our PDF documents, the encoding of characters doesn't match anything else, so copying and pasting from a PDF to another application doesn't work.

This is explained here: http://xmlgraphics.apache.org/fop/fonts.html#embedding

We need to either stop embedding the fonts (which means that the appropriate font might not exist on the client, or might be a similar named font with different metrics), or create our embedded fonts with the '-enc ansi' option, which limits the PDF to WinAnsi characters, roughly iso-8889-1

fields.description: At the moment, when applying a style, the original text is wrapped by the style to produce a new node. This new node is then used to replace the content of the range. fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-4093].
  {panel}

Is it possible to specify a default language (preferably in the Administration area) for the site and also override that language in specific spaces (preferably in the Space Administration area)?

Being able to do this would allow a single install to deliver, for example, French and English versions of a space:

http://bach-academie-de-montreal.com

If the property was available via a helper, it would make localisation of macros and themes adapt to the space they are used on.

Ideally, the language should also be output in the <html> tag at the top of every page, for example:

<html lang="en">

More information on that can be found here:

http://www.w3.org/TR/REC-html40/struct/dirlang.html#h-8.1

One of the key benefits here is that it would improve not only help with search engines, but more importantly it would improve accessibility of Confluence for people using screen readers, etc.

Another thing to consider is allowing people to define their preferred languages (in preference order) within their profile - this could also be used to order the list of spaces on the dashboard, etc.
fields.summary: Defining default language for individual spaces

fields.description:
By default, confluence always appends " - Confluence" to the page title and I would like to be able to alter that for several reasons...

1. I'd like to have my own site title in there

2. Serch engine results would look nicer

3. Individuals with disabilities often have devices that convey lists of open windows and assign shortcut keys to them - if they have several confluence windows open, all on the Home page of specific spaces for example, how would they know which to choose from, eg:

Alt+1: Home - Confluence - Mozilla Firefox
Alt+2: Home - Confluence - Mozilla Firefox
Alt+3: Atlassian - Enterprise Wikis, ....
Alt+4: Home - Confluence - Mozilla Firefox

Ideally it should be possible to set a default title for the site, and then override that on a space by space basis.
fields.summary: Setting site title - shown in browser title bar

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-4091].
  {panel}

It would be useful to have <link rel...> tags on pages, blog posts, etc., at least within spaces.

As well as being just generally useful, especially in browsers like Linx and Opera, it is of huge benefit to people with disabilities.

A concise list of the various tags can be found here:

http://www.cs.toronto.edu/~darrell/csc104h/html/tagpages/l/link.htm

Note: There may be more complete references out there, so please check ;)

Here are some draft ponderings over what the tags would be used for:

Bookmark - multiple instances to list the anchors in a page (eg. headings)

Copyright - Not overly useful, but nice to have. Ability to set default copyright for a site, then override in each space and even on each page.

Help - Should be defined in space admin - eg. we create a page called Online Help so we specify that for the space. When adding pages, attachments, etc., if there is any related help then it should be automatic (eg. notation guide when adding a page).

Glossary - Should be defined in space admin as either a page title (eg. you create a page called Glossary and list all the terms) but also allow a URL in case there is an external glossary. (FYI, our company is currently working on a glossary system for confluence which we hope to upload to CONFEXT in the next few months).

Home - The defined home page for a space, as specified already in space admin.

Index - The Alphabetical Index witin a space (already there, just need the link tag)

Next / Previous - If the page has siblings, these will be used. If it's a news post, then the links should take you to the next/previous news post.

ToC - The Site Map (tree view) within a space (already there, just need the link tag)

Up - If the page is in a hierarchy, it will be the parent page. If the page is an orphan, it will be the list of orphan pages. A news post will take you to the day/month/year above it. If you are on the home page, it will take you to the dashboard.
fields.summary: Relative Link tags, at least within spaces...

fields.description:
Currently when external links are entered into Confluence pages, the link points directly to the linked page. This allows the linked site to harvest internal addresses (potentially containing page titles) of a private Confluence instance by logging the browser referrer header.

Confluence should have an option to enable "safe external links". This should include two features: allow the administrator to specify a list of "safe sites" (such as all internal servers) where linking can be direct. Then, if safe linking is enabled, Confluence would link to any pages which aren't on the safe list through an redirect page which would clear the browser referrer.
fields.summary: Safe external links

When attempting to create a page using a template (as seen on the JIRAEXT homepage with this link:

  http://confluence.atlassian.com/pages/createpage-entervariables.action?spaceKey=JIRAEXT&templateName=Extension+Template&parentPageId=11569

The template page is missing a title. It says " - Confluence".
fields.summary: Edit page with template is missing a title

fields.description: Attempting to create a new template,I tried both project templates and global templates. When clicking "add" or "preview" button, the page refreshes back to the edit page, but nothing happens. No template is created, no error message is given.
fields.summary: Can't create a template

fields.description: It would be nice to allow users to include an attachment with their comments. Users want to attach an image or file to a comment to better express themselves.
fields.summary: Allow attaching of images or files when writing comments

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-4075].
  {panel}

The permissions view currently in confluence is from a resource. It would be VERY convenient if it was from the viewpoint of a user or group.

Today, it is "show me all users/groups that have access to this resource and their permissions".

We also need: "show me all the resources this user/group has access to and the permissions on that resource"

This would make it easier when adding a new user/group. If I have 5 spaces that user/group needs access to, I currently have to do this 5 times by visiting Space Administration for each space and granting permissions to that user/group.
fields.summary: Need easier permission administration

fields.description: Could we split the ability to add / edit templates out from the rest of the 'administer Confluence' rights? We want to allow users to create and edit templates but don't want them to be able to administer the rest of confluence, at the moment this doesn't seem possible to set up.
fields.summary: CLONE -Security setting to allow non adminstrators to create / edit templates
Security setting to allow non adminstrators to create / edit templates

fields.description:
When I have a page in space test1 with a link to a page in space test2 (e.g. [test2:Link]), and I rename the page Link to NewLink in space test2, the page in test1 doesn't get updated with the new page name: The link still says [test2:Link] instead of [test2:NewLink]

The same happens if you have pages in only one space and blanks at the end of the link: [Link] gets updated to [NewLink] if you rename the page Link, but [Link ] is not updated, neither is [Alias for Link|Link ].
fields.summary: Links don't get updated on rename

fields.description:
Create nice summaries of search results.

For attachments, look inside the content of the attachment itself to pull out a reasonably accurate summary.
fields.summary: Make search return summaried excerpts matching query
